items.title: What Survivor Can Teach Us About the Government
items.description: America’s politics now run like a reality show — and the villains keep winning.

items.title: The Budget Crunch Is Coming. States Must Adjust Their Spending Accordingly
items.description: The trend toward budget shortfalls is unmistakable.

items.title: A Farewell to the Separation of Powers?
items.description: With Trump v. Slaughter , presidential power may grow larger than ever before.

items.title: A Catfight in a Snake Pit in Philly’s Art Museum
items.description: While crazies quarrel in the City of Brotherly Love, Boston’s MFA does a superb Winslow Homer show . . . What does it all have to do with Canadians?

items.title: A Fair Accounting of Pete Hegseth’s Role in the Caribbean Boat Strike
items.description: There are plenty of reasons to doubt the Washington Post , but that does not make the Trump administration’s military campaign prudent or constitution...
